miic.core.macro.plot_corr_matrix¶

plot_corr_matrix(base_dir='.', save_dir='./img', center_win_len=500, axis=1, plot_selected_curves=False, selected_curves_idx_list=[])[source]¶

Plot all correlation matrixes stored in a folder as .mat file

This is a basic function to plot the correlation matrixes stored in a folder as .mat files. It loads each matrix, check if time information are available in the same file and then creates a contourf plot with 20 levels. It also add simple lables to each axis and a generic title “Correlation Matrix”. It is also possible to generate, at the same time, plots of a list of interesting correlation functions just setting plot_selected_curves==True and passing the list of indexes in the parameter selected_curves_idx_list.

Parameters:
  • base_dir (directory) – Where the auto-cross correlation matrix are stored
  • save_dir (directory) – Directory where to save the resulting images
  • center_win_len (int) – How many samples will be taken from the central part of the correlation function
  • axis (int) – On which axis apltly the selection (axis==1 cols, axis==1 rows)
  • plot_selected_curves (bool) – If it is requested to plot single correlation functions
  • selected_curves_idx_list (list of int) – The list of index (in the selected axis) of the curves that will be ploted
